swahili.text: If the hours are long enough and the pay is short enough, someone will say it’s women’s work.
Love has to be shown by deeds not words.
Money, if you use it, comes to an end; learning, if you use it, increases.
A bad brother is far better than no brother.
A bad job is not as wothless as a good game.
A barber does not shave himself.
A big heart is better than a big brain.
A bird that imitates others does not get used to a place.
A blind person does not forget his walking stick.
A boat doesn't go forward if each one is rowing their own way.
A brother is a cooking pot, and a neighbour is a cooking pot lid.
A cat belonging to the house is not chased away.
A cat can never he made to lie on its back.
A handfull of water can not be grasped.
A handsome finger gets the ring.
A hasty person misses the sweet things.
A hen does not break her own eggs.
A hen's kick does not hurt her chick.
A hungry man observes no taboos.
A hunter is not afraid of thorns.
A husband of a mother is a father.
A lazy person with a nephwe does not eat dry rice.
A letter from the heart can be read on the face.
Pleasent words will draw the snake from its hole.
Put a riddle to a fool a clever person will solve it.
Refusing and wanting at the same time.
Regrets are like a child, They come some considerable time after event.
Rice is all one but they are many ways of cooking it.
Running on the roof finishes at the edge.
Scabics are given to him who has no fingernails.
Serve even an unbeliever to attain your own ends.
Shadow of a stick canot protect one from the sun.
Shark is the famous one in sea the but they many others.
A chick is not taught how to scratch up the ground.
A connoisseur never comes to the end of desire.
A cow is not oppressed by its own hump.
A dancer will not become crippled for dancing calls for grace.
A dead person is not asked for a shroud.
A distant fire does not burn.
A double jointed arm follows the leg action.
A drowning man catches at the water.
A drum that is sounded loudly will soon split.
A dying ear does not feel the medicine.
A log can not move save by the help of rollers.
A messenger is not killed.
A mud hut cannot withstand great shocks.
A new fowl always has string around its legs.
A new thing is a souce of joy even if is sore.
A nice day, a gift for a street peddlar.
A noisy drumming does not last long.
A noisy person is harmless.
A patient man will eat ripe fruits.
A person does not objects to being called, he objects to what he is called for.
Where there are many fowls, millet is not scattered.
Where there are many people, there God is.
Where there are many there is much.
Where there are many, nothing goes wrong.
Where there are old people, nothing goes wrong.
Where there are plenty of trees there are no builders.
Where there is a will there is a way.
Where there is finery, there lies the snare.
Where there trees, there are no builders.
Where there's a will there's a way.
Fire does not beget fire in the end it begets ashes.
Follow bees and you will get honey.
For a fly to die on an ulcer is not bad.
For him who is accustomed to taking giving away is a battle.
Give a wizard a child to bring up.
Giving advice but no one listens.
God does not concell a liar.
Good and evil will never mix.
Gratitude of a donkey is a kick.
Great wit drives away wisdom.
The sick man is the garden of the physicians.
The skin of yesteday's sugarcane is a havest to an ant.
The space under the bed is like a mat.
The teeth of a dog do not lock together.
The timid crow withdraws his wings from harm.
The tongue hurts more than the teeth.
The very thing you do not want, that is what pleases god.
The village cock does not crow in town.
The washer conceals the corpse.
The washer of corpses does no harm to the dead.
what is not eaten by a man, let the devil eat it.
What the heart desires is medicine to it.
When a bull gets his leg broken, he is sure to go back to his yard.
When a child cries for a razor give it him.
When a fool becomes enlightened, the wise man is in trouble.
When a plate is covered, its contents are hidden.
When a poor man gets something he boasts of his new wealth.
When an oxhorn of a news man is sounded, something is wrong.
When brothers quarrel, take a hoe and go and dig; and when they make it up, take a basket and patter the crop.
when the cat goes away, mice reign.
He who asks for salt does so for his own cooking pot.
He who becomes blind in his old age does not lose his way.
He who boasts of his ancestry unduly will bring plenty of trouble upon himself.
He who climbs a ladder comes down again.
He who dances at home will be rewarded.
He who desires all, misses all.
He who desires to make something does not announce his intentions, just turns them into actions.
He who devours his neighbour's fowl, its foot prints will give him away.
He who digs a pit will fall into it himself.
He who dips his finger into honey does not dip it once.
He who fixes his mind much on water ends up not drinkink it.
He who goes to the quarterdeck and forecastle will return to the hold eventualy.
He who has an axe does not lack firewood.
He who is after two things at the same time, one will surely escape him.
He who is carried on the back must cling on.
He who is expled from home has no where to go.
He who is used to strangle, cannot slaughter.
He who laughs at a cripple will not die without becoming himself.
He who likes to eat cows hump will not fail to grow fat.
He who nurses vegeance is not called wise.
When the head of the family dies, that family breaks up.
When tide is high, it ebbs.
When you are eating with a blind man, do not touch his hand.
When you are seized, hold on yourself.
When you go among one-eyed people, put out your own eye.
When you mention a snake, have a stick ready in your hand.
When you play with a lion, do not put your hand in its mouth.
When your Companion is being shaved, put water.
Where it slopes down is where it slopes up.
Where there are experts there will be no lack ot learners.
The child of lion is a lion.
The child who grows up with you is your fellow.
The corpse-washer is washed.
The creaking of the door deprives me of no sleep.
the curse of the fowl does not bother the kite.
The day you go naked, is the day you will meet your father.
The death of not a relative is a wedding.Compared to a death of a relative.
The destroyer of a country is a citizen of that country.
The drunkard's money is being consumed by palm-wine trapper.
The ear does not surpass the head.
ie One eye of a master sees more than four of a servent.
If a native of pemba can get a log he does not relive himself on the ground.ie nothing but the best.
If an arrow goes into a forest it is not lost.
If the hours are long enough and the pay is short enough, someone will say it's women's work.
If the hyena eats the sick man, he will eat the whole one.
If the palmwine tapper is praised, he dilutes the palm-wine with water.
If water is split, it can not be gathered up.
If you are a flag follow the wind.
If you are absent you lose your share.
If you are astonished at Moses' deeds, you will be more astonished at Pharaoh's. Not-Moses declared himself to he a prophet, but Pharaoh declared himself to be God.
The one who buries ivory is the one to dig it up.
The one who has helped others climb the ladder gets kicked in the teeth.
The one who is caught with the skin is the thief.
The path of a liar is short.
The patient eat ripe.
The poison for a word is a word.
The prayer of the chicken hawk does not get him the chicken.
The process of eating is not taught to a child.
The real eater is todays eater not yesterdays.
the remedy of fire is fire.
Along silence followed by mighty noise.
An aimless wanderer wears away his legs.
An artful bird can be trapped in a rotten cage.
An axe with rio handle does not split firewood.
An ear dots not go to bed hungry.
An elephant hunter usually gets killed by an elephant.
An empty hand is not licked.
An evil Indian but his bussiness is good.
An infidel who does you good turn is not like a Muslim who does not.
An ivory tooth is not cure for the lost tooth.
To every child his own neck ornament.
To get lost is to learn the way.
To live long is to see much.
To run is not neccessarily to arrive.
To stumble is not falling down but it is to go forward.
Today is today who says tommorrow is a liar.
Too many captains the ship rolls.
Treat your guest as a guest for two days; on the third day, give him a hoe.
Two bulls do not live in the same shade.
Two crocodiles cannot agree.
Better an intelligent enemy than a stupid friend.
Better delay and get there.
Better to stumble with toe than toungue.
Big houses conceal a lot.
Blessings are better than wealth.
Blood is thicker than water.
Borrowing is like a wedding, repaying is like mourning.
Bribery is the enemy of justice.
Charity is the matter of the heart not of the pocket.
Clouds are the sign of rain.
Mouth is the home of words.
Never give up your own old mat for a better prayer mat which you see passing.
Nine is near ten.
Nobleness is not noble ancestry.
Not all that have claws are lions.
Old droppings do not stink.
Old rust is for the stranger.
One fault does not warrant divorce of a wife.
One finger canot kill a louse.
One fire brand after another keeps fire burning.
A person is asked about his dress not what he has eaten.
A person scratches himself where his hand can reach.
A person who is in too much of a hurry stubs his toe.
A pit of the tongue cannot be covered up by the hand.
A poor man does not pick up things if does they say he stole them.
A poor man has no contempt.
A por man with his child a rich man with his wealth.
A potter eats from a potsherd.
A regular path has no signpost.
A reserve will not decay.
The eater of a goat pays back a cow.
The evil spirit of a man is a man.
The farmer is one but those who eat fruits of his labour are many.
The fear of God is not wearing a white turban.
The gratitude that bees receive is the smoke that people use to expel them and get at their honey.
The Iabour of childbirth is known to the mother.
The juice of an Immature coconut Is not like the real coconut juice.
The laughter of a child lights up the house.
The lion which moves silently is the one that eats meat.
The maker of wooden spoons saves his hand from fire.
A fisheman knows where to look for an octopus.
A flag follows the direction of the wind.
A fly does not mind dying in coconut cream.
A good day becomes evident in the morning.
A good name shines in the dark.
A good place you don't go to is a good place: if you go too often, it isn't a good place any longer.
A good purpose is like a doctor and evil purpose corrupts.
A good thing sells it self a bad one advertises it self.
A goshawk is an egg child, if sleeps hungry its his own fault.
A guine- fowl not lay eggs on strange places.
Usage is like law.
Voluntary is better than force.
Wait a minute! wait a minute! harms the stomach.
War has no eyes.
Water flows down the valley does not climb the hill.
water follows current.
Water in a coconut shell is like an ocean to an ant.
Wealth, if you use it, comes to an end; learning, if you use it, increases.
What beats you is what teaches you.
What is benig talked about is here, and if its not it's comming around behind.
Constant dipping will empty goud of honey.
Constant rubbing of a rope will cut a stone.
Cooling the tongs is not end of forging.
Courage is not the same as fighting someone stronger than you.
Death has its advantages too ie it benifits those who inherit.
Death is blind.
Desire first, death afterwards.
Dirty clothes are washed in the backyard.
Do me a favour during a rainy season and I shall do the same to you during the dry season.
Do not abuse midwives while child-bearing continues.
If you are offered a span, do not take a couple of yards.
If you destroy a bridge, be sure you can swim.
If you do not fill up a crack, you will have to build a wall.
If you do not seal the holes, you will have to rebuild the walls.
If you don't know death look at the grave.
If you dont fill a crack, you will build a wall.
If you find the river flooded, wait.
If you find your own house is on fire, you may be sure that your neighbour's house is burning much more fiercely.
If you love other people's children, you will love your own even more.
If you see amber, ambergis is behind.
He who does not admit defeat is not a sportsman.
He who drinks water with one hand finds out his thirst is still there.
He who earns calamity, eats it with his family.
He who earns his living in the sun, eats in the shade.
He who eats another mans food will have his own food eaten by others.
He who eats bitter things gets sweet things too.
He who eats with you will not die with you except he who was born with you.
He who enjoys the first fruit of a country is son of that country.
He who fears the crying of a child, will cry himself.
He who fights with a wall will only hurt his hand.
You cannot know the defects of a house you have not slept in.
You canot know the bugs of a bed that you have not lain on.
You dont take viengeance on silliness.
You dont throw stones at an approching craclin noise in the bush wait and see what is it first.
You may climb a thorn tree, and be unable to come down.
You will not necessarily get what you desire, you will get what is appointed you.
Your companion's body is beside.
Your companion's burden is a load of kapok.
Your own bad place is far better than your companion's place.
Your own small place is not like a big place of your companion.
Don't quarrel with the coconut-palm climber: the coconut has been eaten by the moon.
Don't travel under another's lucky star.
Eating is sweet, digging is weariness.
Effort will not counter faith.
Every bird flies with its own wings.
Every door with its own key.
Every vessel has its own waves.
Every who streches a skin on a drum, pulls the skin own his own side.
Everyone should contribute when collection is made.
Eyes have no screens, they see all that is within view.
Where they is mourning someone has died.
Where you have an enemy, you will also surely arid a friend.
Who digs the well should not be refused water.
Who tells the truth is never wrong.
Why drive away fowls from the dung you do not eat yourself?.
With many captains, the ship does not sail properly.
Words alone wont break bones.
Work the clay while it is still wet.
You are blaming the hawk, the falcon is killing the chickens.
You can not know the extent of water in a pond that you have never been to.
She who is pregnant, is pregnant-even though she wrap herself in an 'mkaja'.
Slow moving lion eats meat.
Songs learnt from outside sources are not used at a dance so long.
Stretch hide while it is still green.
Stretch your legs the length of your bed.
Take one, not that you may return with ten.
Talk of the devil, and you'll hear the rustle of his wings.
That is fashionable in town is never prohibited.
That which eats you up is in your clothing.
That which is written by God is what is.
A tailor does not select his cloth.
A thief finds another one.
A thief is a rogue but the one who repays is a gentleman.
A thief is caught by his fellow thief.
A thing that is firmly fixed cannot be dislodged except with much trouble.
A tongue has no bone.
A traveller does not make a mess where he had made a camp as he might one day come back.
A traveller is poor, even though he being a ruler.
A tree of your height cannot shade you.
A vessel running agroud has no captain.
An obstinete child does not suffer save on the day of festival.
An old man always keeps something in reserve.
Anger brings loss.
Are you a duck your mind is with your children?.
Are you a dugong, you cannot bear a wound?.
Are you a Jeta, you do not move?.
Arrogance is not gentlemanly.
As you bring up a child, so he will be.
As you tapped it you will drink.
Asking questions is not silly.
One who selects his hoe is not real farmer.
One who stores half grown fruit eats it rotten.
One who talks to himself can not be wrong.Ie no one to correct him.
One who walks with no reason is not like one who sits without reason, the one who walks might pick up something.
One with a scar, do not think him healed.
One's foul smelling does not sicken one self but merely disguts one.
Out of sight out of mind.
Patience attracts happiness; it brings near that which is far.
Patience is the key to tranquility.
Pemba does not run away fro a small shower.
Do not abuse palm-wine tappers while drunkness persists.
Do not compete with Kari, Kari comes from God.
Do not forget what it is to be a sailor because of being a captain yourself.
Do not neglect the undoing for the setting.
Do not pretend to be a white fowl.
Do not put a grass turban on my head.
Do not roast baobab kernels and leave those who have teeth chewing.
Do not try to fight a lion if you are not one yourself.
Do not wake one who is sleeping; you will fall asleep yourself.
Don't plant a seed in the sea.
One follows bees will never fail to get honey.
One who always depends on his brother will die poor.
One who curses someone in public, brings it on himself in private.
One who gives birth cannot avoid defilement.
One who has been bitten by a snake, when he sees grass he he gets afraid.
One who has eyes is not told to look.
One who has little relish must eat sparingly.
One who hides private parts wont get a child.
One who keeps silent, endures.
One who rides two horses at once will split asunder.
Its nice throw a spear to a pig, but painful when thrown to you.
Joke, joke, discharges pus.
Kindness does not go rotten.
Kiss the hand you can not cut.
Leave well alone! You wont improve matters by going on tinkering.
Let a strong man pass.
Let the guest come so that the host may benifit.
Let us see then tell; hearing is not seeing.
Life can be understood backwards, but we live it forwards.
Little by little fills up the measure.
If you see something and say nothing, you will have nothing to suffer for.
If you see vessels afloat, remember that they have had to be built.
If you take of your clothes for water you must bathe.
If you throw a millipede you should throw away the stick you picked it up with.
If you want beauty, you must be injured.
If you want to eat pig, choose one which is fat.
It is better for the eyes to die than the heart.
It is better to build bridges than walls.
It is better to lose your eyes than to lose your heart.
It is not hard to nurse a pregnency, but it is hard to bring up a child.
The ape does not see his own backside, he Sees his companion's.
The area covered by your life is not as important as what you can build on it.
The beareved begins the wailing latter others join.
The begining is bud the end is coconut.
The begining of a dance is lele.
The begining of a mat-making is two slips of raffia leaf.
The blindnes of that one is his good fortune.
The brotherhood of coconuts is a meeting in the cook-in pot.
The carrier of a secret message is not told its meaning.
The child of a snake is a snake.
The way of a liar is short.
There are three things which if one does not know, one cannot live long in the world: what is too much for one, what is too little for one, and what is just right for one.
There is no bad patience.
There is weeping when separated, there is quarreling when together.
They is no distance that has no end.
They is no incence for something rotting.
They is no secret between two people.
Things dont just happen by accidents.
To a physician a sick man is a garden.
To a seamen of Kwale, death by water is common experience.
He who plays with mud will get splashed.
He who praises rain has been rained on.
He who renounces his ancestrey is like a slave.
He who requires what is under the bed must bend for it.
He who ridicules the good will be overtaken by evil.
He who riducules a deformed person becomes deformed himself.
He who selects coconut with great care ends up getting a bad coconut.
He who slaughters a beast does not hesitate about skinning it.
He who sows disorderly fashion will eat likewise.
He who spekes ill of someone close to you in your presence sends you to tell him so.
He who trusts in God lacks nothing.
He who who flings a stone amid a crowd, does not know the it hits.
Hearing is not seeing.
Hold him! Hold him! and you yourself after him.
How can you be burnt by chilies which you have not eaten?.
Hurry hurry has no blessings.
I am a mud hut, I can not stand shocks.
I ate honey in my childhood, and its sweetness is still in my tooth.
I have anointed you with kohl, do you, in return, anoint me with pepper?.
I shall not suffer illness while doctors abound.
A warning to the wise is a blessing, to the fool an insult.
A well-worn coir-rope is better than a new rope made from raffia.
A wepon which you don't have in hand wont kill a snake.
A wife is like clothes and banana plant needs weeding.
A witchdoctor does not cure himself.
Abuses are the result of seeing one another too often.
Accidents will happen.
After distress, solace.
After hardship comes relief.
Aiming isn't hitting.
A rope parts where it is thinnest.
A rotten coconut in a heap spoils the wholesome ones.
A satisfied person does not know the hungry man.
A sick person is not asked for porridje.
A single hand can not nurse a child.
A single hand can not slaughter a cow.
A sinking vessel needs no navigation.
A small pot boils quickly.
A son will be what he was taught.
A stranger is like a white fowl.
Had you known what bees eat, you would not have tasted the honey.
Happiness requires something to do, something to love and something to hope for.
Haste does not result in prosperity.
Haste has no blessing.
Haste is from the Devil.
Haste makes waste and waste makes want.
Have you changed into a cuttle-fish, you heap live embers on yourself?.
He laughs at scar who has received no wound.
He that does not fear a bull must be a bull himself.
He wanders around by day a lot, learns a lot.
The country rooster dows not crow in the town.
Even your dog knows the homes of your friends.
The thread follows the needle.
A chicken's prayer doesn't affect a hawk.
The way a donkey expresses gratitude is by giving someone a bunch of kicks.
An envious person requires no reason to practice envy.
It's always good to save or invest for the future.
Hurry—haste has no blessing.
The water pot presses upon the small circular pad.
The hen with baby chicks doesn't swallow the worm.
When elephants fight, the grass gets hurt.
I pointed out to you the stars and all you saw was the tip of my finger.
It is only a male elephant that can save another one from a pit.
A deaf ear is followed by death and an ear that listens is followed by blessings.
One who always depends on his brother will die poor
God is our neighbour when our brother is absent
A bad brother is far better than no brother
Wisdom is wealth.
Where there are experts there will be no lack of learners.
War has no eyes
Much wealth brings many enemies.
Love has to be shown by deeds not words.
A patient person never misses a thing.
Hurry, hurry has no blessings.
To run is not necessarily to arrive.
Once water has been spilled, it cannot be scooped back up.
A bad coconut spoils the good ones.
A bad workman blames his tools.
A boat doesn’t go forward if each one is rowing his own way.
A good child is a crown of honor for his parents.
A person does not become clever by carrying books along.
Avarice is the root of all evil.
swahili.description: Greediness is the cause of all evils.

swahili.text: Avoid those who always praise you.
Begin with patience, end with pleasure.
Better to stumble with the toe than with the tongue.
First work, then wages.
God does not hide a liar.
Had you known what bees eat, you would not have tasted honey.
He who tells the truth is never wrong.
If you sow the wind, you will harvest a hurricane.
Indecision is the house of hunger.
It is not necessary to blow out the other person’s lantern to let yours shine.
It’s always good to save or invest for the future.
Life’s caravan never turns back.
One knee doesn’t bring up a child.
One man’s fate is another man’s lesson.
Profit surpasses pride.
Respect for a stupid person is stupidity.
Rest comes only after hardship.
Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors.
The bad craftsman quarrels with his tools.
The gratitude that bees receive is the smoke that people use to expel them and get at their – honey.
The hen with baby chicks doesn’t swallow the worm.
Two bulls cannot live in one stable.
Unity is strength, division is weakness.
War among grasshoppers delights the crow.
Water does not boil if taken away from fire.
Words are silver, but answers are gold.
Yesterday and the day before yesterday are not like today.
When two elephants fight, it is the grass that gets trampled.
Don’t plant a seed in the sea.
Death is blind.
Life has meaning only in the struggle. Triumph or defeat is in the hands of the Gods. So let us celebrate the struggle!
Aiming isn’t hitting.
A single finger does not break a louse.
When the cat has gone away, the mice prevail.
Many cooks spoil the sauce.
Education has no ending.
How come that the pepper which you are not eating is too hot for you?
If you want to eat a pig, eat a fat one.
The route of a liar is short.
Blood is heavier than water.
He who sows haphazardly, eats haphazardly.
Where there is a will, there is a way.
Don’t insult midwives as long as you are still able to give birth.
Where smoke is being generated, there is a fire.
Patience attracts success.
Wait at the bottom, for the one who is up.
A remote stick does not kill a snake.
He who isn’t around, his share isn’t around either .
A person is people.
Don’t provoke bees.
If a child cries for a razor-blade, give it to him.
Habit is a skin.
A drowning person does not stop thrashing around.
Give way to the strong one.
Anger brings damage.
Unity is strength, disunity is weakness.
If water has been spilt, it cannot be scooped up.
Delay so that you may arrive.
A spear is only against a pig; against a human being it is painful.
The remedy for fire is fire.
Donating is only a matter of willingness and not wealth.
If you don’t seal a crack, you will build wall.
Intelligence is an asset.
